My friend and I came here during lunch on a Friday. We didn't wait long. We sat at the counter/bar. It was fun watching them cook and make our food.

I just ordered the Two Eggs to make it simple. The potatoes are crispy! yumm! They cooked my eggs to my liking with added toast! Thank you.

A great spot for brunch. I can't wait to go back!!!!
author: Majileen C.

description: My experience at Plow was amazing for three reasons: my best friend met me for brunch, we only had to wait for 10 minutes to get a seat inside and the food was some of the best breakfast I've had in San Francisco. Crispy fried potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes, scrambled eggs, pork sausage and a side of mochi cake was shared between myself and my friend on a Wednesday morning. We "mmm"ed and scarfed it all down while enjoying the warm atmosphere. Tables are pretty close together but I didn't mind. They also have a few tables outside if you don't mind the foggy droplets. We shared the Plow Plate and the mochi cake which was recommended to us by the people sitting next to us and finishing their great meal. Our waitress was attentive and we were in and out in no time. I have to say the pancakes, potatoes and mochi cake are a must and their biscuits looked fluffy and buttery. Their prices are higher than a diner but you get fresh ingredients with every bite. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in SF (as long as it's a weekday because I'm sure weekends are crazy and they don't take reservations).
author: Ashley M.

description:
The BEST pancakes I've ever had! 

Location: so the building itself is really nice. Plenty of room inside for maybe like 20-30 people. The only downside is that since this place is so popular, the wait is fairly long. My girlfriend and I waited for an hour before being seated. But don't worry. If you're going to wait for anything let it be this! 

Service: although I felt slightly rushed, I won't let it change my rating for this place considering how great the food was. It may have been because we came towards the end of closing time. Don't get me wrong, the people here are friendly, we just felt slightly rushed. 

Food: I ordered the plow expecting a typical meal of bacon, eggs, hash browns and pancakes. What I got was far from your typical breakfast! My favorite park about the meal had to have been the hash browns. I don't know how they make them or season them but they were amazing! Also the lemon ricotta pancakes were so fluffy and flavorful that I regretted not getting a stack of that all on its own! Amazing place! Definitely worth waiting for!
author: Joseph C.

description: Delicious and well worth the wait. French toast was amazing. Only complaint is that no one seems to know how to close the door making it often chilly.
author: Auralina B.

description:
If you reside in San Francisco and do not live under a rock, chances are you've heard of Plow. This may be because the food is delicious. It is equally possible you know them only for their ridiculous wait times (a problem that has become emblematic of any metropolitan area with a love of basic, bougie, boozy brunch). 

Brief summary of why the food is great. Any Google search will yield that it is "comfort" and "rustic style." What this means in practice is an almost southern amount of decadence with all of the artisanal perks of any bay area establishment. You have your all inclusive brunch platter called "The Plow." But the menu also has chia seed pudding and a plate of gluten free, almond flour pancakes. 

More on The Plow. It's probably the best option on the menu, especially for a first timer. Eggs are prepared to your liking, and you get the choice between pork sausage, chicken apple sausage, and bacon. However the main attractions are the potatoes (so popular they are named "plow potatoes"). These little guys are perfectly crispy on the outside but ultimately melt on your tongue. Anyone on a diet--please evacuate immediately. To add insult to carbaphobic injury, the lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious. They are smaller than you'd expect, which is both a curse and a blessing.

The great food isn't the only reason this place is so busy. The interior of the restaurant is tiny, as if it is trying to spite you and your hungry stomach. There is ample outdoor seating for those who are waiting to be seated, but I'd also recommend exploring the surrounding area, or even walking all the way to the Mission, like one Yelper did. You will literally have enough time to walk several miles and back (if you can bear the hill, that is). Especially if you're trying to score brunch on a Sunday (but why would you do that to yourself). Alternatively, ordering a grapefruit mimosa is another good way to kill time.

If you plan on wandering--which I highly suggest--make sure you call them periodically or come back by the suggested time. When they invite people to come in, they do not call said people on the phone. If you aren't there, your spot is lost to the next people in line. I'm pretty sure they do this on purpose as a form of line management. Every time someone is called and doesn't show up, everyone waiting outside cheers.

I only eat here once a year, because that's about how long it takes for me to no longer feel disenchanted by the wait time. A year out, and the memory of the line suddenly feels less sharp. "Maybe this time will be different," I think to myself. 

It never is.
author: Nicole C.

description:
Small, bright and cozy place!
We got lucky, came on Saturday at 1 pm and seated immediately.
Buttermilk biscuit is perfect, buttery and moist inside, crispy outside.
I ordered the plow, tasted good but not as great as I thought it would be.
Love the scrambled eggs and crispy potatoes but not a big fan of their ricotta pancake, too dry for me.
Not sure if I will be back, but maybe I will try the breakfast sandwich next time.
author: Aldora Z.

description:
Plow is the epitome of a perfect brunch spot!

Cute neighborhood, really chill atmosphere, the most friendly/down-to-earth employees!

The food is amazing! The Plow Breakfast is $16, comes with your choice of breakfast meat, eggs, rosemary potatoes and two mini lemon ricotta pancakes. AMAAAAAZING!!!

All in all, you're going to have to wait a while... but trust when I say the wait is worth it!
author: Corina M.

description:
One of my favorite brunch spots! Also helps that it's walking distance. 

Lemon ricotta pancakes are the best! 

I recommend the plow so you can try all their stuff. 
Comes with bacon, potatoes and sausage patties. 

Egg over easy
author: tsubasa m.

description:
I finally understand what the hype is about. I came here on an early Friday morning and waited about 30 minutes for a table. The wait was well worth it. My friend and I shared the egg sandwich with bacon on top and the plow. Everything was absolutely MINDBLOWING. I never knew how wrong I was doing breakfast until I had the eggs at plow. They were honestly the most perfect eggs I've had in my life? The yolk was the right amount of runny. And the potatoes are honestly life altering. The seasoning is on point and the potatoes themselves are just the right amount of crispy. And the pancakes! I normally hate sweets, especially sweet breakfast, but I could eat these ricotta pancakes for breakfast for everyday of my life. They are not too sweet, light, and fluffy.

Overall, plow more than lives up to its hype.
author: Jean J.

description: Be prepared to wait.  We put our names down on a list and were told hour to hour and half.  So we left came back after an hour and we're seated 15 mins later.  I had the prosciutto and gruyere toast which was the perfect breakfast for me.  The toast was perfect lightly crispy with the perfect amount of chew.  The greens added to make it a nice clean balance meal and the prosciutto was nice and flavourful without being overwhelmingly salty.  I tried the lemon ricotta pancake and was not a fan.  I don't know if they had a different chef cooking it but it just felt too soggy for me.  My husband and gf also tried the pancake as well and were not thrilled with it either.
author: Su H.

description:
As one of the top places for brunch, the wait is expected but still crazy, probably 40 min ~ 1 hour is expected. We actually went to near by coffee shop (Farley's) for awhile and come back.

Plow is really small and crowded, the outdoor seating is usually kind of cold even on a mild and sunny day, but they do provide blanket. Bring a jacket if you don't want to wait too long and sit outside.

The service is super fast and efficient! (I guess with the wait, they have to be). We ordered The Plow, french toast, chia seed pudding and Prosciutto toast. The portion is big...! Especially the french toast, three super thick and big toasts! Be prepare :P 
I think for the first time, The Plow is a good choice because it has the ricotta pancake and potatoes that Plow is famous for. The potatoes are super delicious! Pancake was okay, more like a cake? Chia seed pudding is a surprise! I love it! Everyone love the prosciutto toast as well.

Overall the food are tasty, big portion (prepare to bring home some leftover, or share), good service, if only the wait is shorter. It deserves the famous name.
author: Ya K.

description: Came here with a friend on a Saturday for brunch. We showed up at 10:45 and got seated at 12:30. I got the soft scrambled eggs with mushrooms and goat cheese and was expecting an amazing dish based on the wait time. It was pretty good, but nothing extraordinary. The eggs could've used more seasoning, or some more goat cheese. At 1:30 they asked us to leave so they could give the table to someone else. Overall good food, but a little overhyped.
author: Sara T.

description:
Chicken Tinga, FTW!

My Houston friend and Oakland friend and I decided to meet up for brunch at Plow. The wait was 20 minutes. We were seated promptly. Our coffee and water glasses were never empty and when I found the chair a bit uncomfortable they were nice enough to find me a new one.

The Chicken Tinga was the perfect brunch meal - both breakfast and lunch. I also recommend the Plow Home Fries - AMAZING!
author: Tara H.

description: The food was amazing. I came two months back on a Saturday and the wait was 2 hours. So I left and decided to come back on a later date. It's a Tuesday and it was still a 10 minute wait but the food was def worth it. I would come again!
author: Gabrielle T.

description:
Waited about 50 minutes on a Friday morning for a table of 4.

Ordered the breakfast sandwich. Highly recommend. I loved it, and added avocado is a must. Tried a bite of pancakes, amazing! Wish I would have ordered them. 

The potatoes will change your life. So crunchy & perfectly cooked. So the only negative is that they serve ketchup in these tiny tiny ramekins & I go through ketchup like nobody's business, so I had to ask for ketchup like 8 times. 

Love The Plow.
author: Jaki F.

description: YUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUM. Went there for breakfast. It was delish. It's the coolest. Put it on the top of your breakfast list.
author: Ried C.

description:
Absolutely loved this place! It can get pretty crowded even on week day mornings so it's best to get there earlier in the morning. I had the breakfast sandwich with avocado added and it was unreasonably delicious! Eggs cooked to perfection, fresh avocado, an amazing bun, and delicious aioli. The dish came with breakfast potatoes which also did not disappoint.

The restaurant has an incredible atmosphere and I enjoyed sitting at the counter watching the cooks do their thing! Will definitely return here next time I'm in town.
author: Jared L.

description: Eggs benedict were delicious! However, I wouldn't get their mimosas again, unless I am looking for a kick on the head, that leaves me reaching out for the bottle of Advil.
author: Ale B.

description: This place is a great brunch spot! We came here on a Wednesday so there wasn't much of a wait. I ordered the plow which was delicious! The lemon pancakes were the best part, super soft and tasty! Service was great and the server came back to check on us multiple times and even let us split our check 5 ways (which is total pain - I know). Definitely coming back!!
author: Christine M.

description:
I'm going to keep this review short and quick, which is the complete opposite of the waiting time/procedure to get into Plow (ooh, BURN)

Came here during prime brunch time on Sunday with the lil sis, and we easily found street parking in the hills of Potrero Hills. We wrote out name down around 11AM and knew that we would have to wait for 1+ hours, so walked all the way to Boba Guys in Mission to kill time. The whole thing took about one hour, and by the time we were back at Plow, we were 2nd in line for our spot!! (I HIGHLY recommend doing something like this while you wait--trust me, you won't miss anything). Once we got to Boba Guys, we also called Plow to ask about our spot and they politely told us that we still had about 40 minutes left. SCORE.

Food-wise, plow is delicioso. The Mexican dudes working the kitchen are right by the bar, so the bar seaters can watch them make the fried egg sandwich to the french toast...it's a beautiful thing to see. I devoured the fried egg sandwich and my sis had the french toast. Their crispy potatoes are TO DIE FOR, just as everybody else has commented. Their portion sizes run along the perfect size to a little bit too much--I only noticed a few takeaway boxes being used. Our server was a kind and polite young Asian lady who was quick and had great humor. Shoutout to everyone at Plow who kept their smiles on and politeness intact throughout their rid

I wouldn't come back any time soon because of the long wait time, but if someone was DYING to come back, I'd do the same thing I did the first time--write my name down, walk anywhere within a 1-1.5 hour distance, and come back just in time.
author: Jodi H.

description: Dang! This place was so good. The only crummy part was the hour-long wait, but it was well worth it. The stinging nettle scrambled eggs were cooked to perfection -- they were not runny or too firm, but just right. Secretly I came here to try their biscuits and they did not disappoint. There's something special about this buttery, flakey baked good. I'm absolutely coming back again...and soon! Pro Tip: Get there when the doors open to avoid the wait.
author: Melissa P.

description:
Have I turned into one of those stereotypical San Franciscans who will happily wait hours for brunch?  Hardly, but somehow I thought I'd beat the crowds on a Sunday morning if I showed up at Plow by 10AM (this always works in the Mission?).  Yeah, no.  The place was packed and there were at least 20 people loitering out front.  We waited exactly two hours for brunch at Plow.  Next time I'll try for 8AM. 

And it was totally worth it.  Like everything was really, really good....from our (shared entrees) to the salad, to the coffee and the jam.  Highly recommended.  Get The Plow only if you've starved yourself in preparation since at least the day before, or share with a friend.  Get the buttermilk biscuits too.
author: Joanne G.

description:
This place is always so busy! And for good reason. It has really good food and drinks, and the staff are friendly... Just need to make it to the top o' that hill lol

The times I've been here have been on weekdays for brunch/lunch. The wait was usually about 30 minutes, which is okay I guess compared to other brunch places in SF, but probably not what you'd be willing to wait if you're ever in a rush.

The last time I was there, I tried the breakfast sandwich. It was really good, though messy since the eggs are cooked still runny - luckily, I was warned about this ahead of time by the waiter lol. I also shared a side of the Hong Kong toast with my friend which was a nice brunch dessert topper.

It's a great place overall and I'm sure I'll be back sometime :)
author: Bianca C.

description: The food is not that good. Arguably not worth the price point, but definitely not worth the line. Go down the street to Farley's where they have quick over-the-counter bites, and you'll thank yourself later (when you have an extra two hours free because you didn't wait in line all morning).
author: Woody D.

description:
After all the reviews I read on yelp, I expected that I would have to wait for a long time so I brought a book along, but then again, I was by myself, so I waited about 15 minutes and was seated. 

I decided to get the fried egg sandwich; decided to add some avocado.  The bread was deliciously buttery and the fried egg was still runny when I cut into it.  The frisee was definitely a great counterpoint to all the delicious fattiness there was with the eggs, bread and avocado.  The potatoes that came with it were deep fried (always a good sign) and sprinkled generiously with salt.  I also ordered the iced chai tea with almond milk. It was pretty good, but I really should have gotten an alcoholic drink 

Next time, I'll definitely have to get the plow or just those pancakes because they do sound really good.

Protip: get there early (unless it's a selfie date then you don't really have to wait).
author: Nina Y.

description: A-MAZE-ING!!! For starters, Plow is absolutely adorable from the outside. I was charmed the second I walked up. We got seated outside and it was a chilly morning but have no fear, they have blankets! All of the food was just perfect. I 100% recommend.
author: Kate H.

description: Came here for brunch today at around 1:30 PM they close for brunch at 2:00 PM but we think they will seat you as long as you out your name on the list before two. We waited probably 20 minutes and then were seated. I tried the black bergamot tea and it was good. I wish that would have double bagged the tea since they give you a whole pot and one tea bag isn't quite enough for the full flavor. My brother had coffee and the waitresses come by frequently for refills. For breakfast I got the lemon ricotta pancakes because I love lemon ricotta pancakes. These were just so so. I mean they were good but as a lover of lemon ricotta pancakes these were not the best I've had. They could use much more lemon flavor and could spruce up the blueberry compote as well. Maybe give you a bit more since there were about 12 blueberries in total and add a little more to it maybe some liqueur flavor or a wow factor. Perhaps I should have gone for the plow breakfast (pancakes, sausage, eggs, potatoes) for the price. $16 for just pancakes is a little steep.  My brother got the gruyere toast and really enjoyed his meal. I tried one of the potatoes and they are spot on. The dining area is beautiful, they play current music, and the service is on point. There was not one thing on the menu I wasn't interested in trying I just think I may have ordered wrong.
author: Lauren R.

description: I'm not much of a breakfast/brunch girl but I definitely enjoyed it here! We ordered the plow and the two eggs breakfast and I was very happy with it! Service was decent and the wait wasn't too long on a Wednesday morning (watch out for street cleaning!) The only thing that was a little strange was sharing a table with another group... Other than that I'm a fan!
author: Jenny E.

description:
Quick Review: When they say the wait is 2 hours they are not kidding. I took my mom here and we walked around the neighborhood for a good 45 minutes. When we returned I thought surely it would only be another 30 minutes. I started to get hangry (angry+hungry) so we ordered a biscuit w honey butter which was an excellent idea. I suggest arriving right when they open at 8AM to get seated before 10AM. I definitely enjoyed my meal but I think this place is more hype than anything else.

FOOD
Biscuit w Honey Butter ($4.25) - super good!
Lemon Ricotta Pancakes ($14) - yummm
Eggs Benedict w Spinach and Mushrooms ($14.75) - the Hollandaise was perfect! I wish the egg was more yokey but still very good

SERVICE
Once we were seated our food came out pretty quick. Our server was very nice and gave suggestions of what to try.

AMBIANCE
Cute and very homey! For it being a small space, there were big windows to brighten the room. Wooden tables are all the rage with SF restaurants and Plow has the same theme. This is weird but the restroom is actually super nice too haha.
author: Brittany S.

description:
This place has a very bad seating policy. They reserve seats by the size of the party, not your order in the queue. Thus, if a table with a party size different from yours becomes available, they won't give it to you. They'll give it to someone behind you with that size, even if it fits you.

The waitresses also had the audacity to hand me the bill saying "take your time" then coming back later and saying "we have quite a wait". Make up your mind.
author: Benjamin G.

description:
Although the wait was long, it was worth it. The staff was friendly and able to accommodate us quickly and efficiently. I absolutely loved watching the chefs prepare our meals while seated at the counter. In fact, they we were so mesmerized by their artistry that they noticed and gave us a free bowl of fresh and crispy potatoes. The food was outstanding; I had the Plow, which I highly recommend. 

Also, great music. A lot of old-school rap/hip-hop.
author: Kelsey A.

description: Good food, menu has some unique items and also some traditional options with a slight spin. Lots of good to try here but waits can be ridiculous.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Great service and delicious food. def. order the  Salmon eggs benedict 
- Dungeness crab scramble the potatoes are a perfect crunch and good portion size.
author: Eshme W.

description:
Came to plow after a recommendation from a family member. I'm not a huge brunch/breakfast person, but I'd change my mind for Plow.

Getting there at about 8:30am on a Saturday, we waited a good 20 minutes to be seated. It's definitely busy, with crowded seating indoors and just a few tables outdoors. We didn't mind the wait - the weather was spectacular and the view was pleasant. There was no issue finding parking, and we had fun parking at a 90 degree angle to the street.

Servers are casual and attentive. There was overall a relaxed atmosphere. The coffee was wonderful. I had their Plow, scrambled eggs with chicken apple sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. I personally wasn't a huge fan of the sausage, but my husband loved it. The scrambled eggs were cooked appropriately, but nothing really to write home about. Their big 5-star review items are the crispy potatoes and the lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are perfectly crisped and salted, very hearty. The lemon ricotta pancakes... mouthwatering. moist, rich, slight hint of cheesy texture, slight sweetness from the lemon. This place gets 5 stars for that alone!

To top it off, the restaurant derives its products from local markets and farms, which i LOVE. There's nothing like supporting your local farmers. Their menu changes daily, so be aware that they may not have the same thing two days in a row.
author: Lyn M.

description:
This place is the best place to get brunch while in the city. I always wanted to try this place but I always see a long line and sometimes the wait can be 1-2 hr wait. So finally one day, my bf and I have decided to wait it out and see what they hype was all about. When we got there on a Wednesday around 11am, we only waited about 20 mins before getting seated. I sat at the counter with my boyfriend and we had the best view in the restaurant. I ordered the plow that came with lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage patty, over medium eggs, and the plow potatoes. We got to see how everything was made and were anxiously waiting for our food to come. Let me first start off by saying, everything tasted so fresh and delicious, that I am currently drooling while typing this review. Everything was perfect! The potatoes and pancake were my favorite. The potatoes were nice and crispy and had a really nice flavor to them. The pancakes were very soft and flulffy!

It is a lot of food for one person but I couldn't put my fork down! This is a really great place for breakfast and lunch. Definitely come here early to avoid a long wait. Service is pretty good here too, the waitress is attentive and refilled our waters when empty. Will come back again and try their other items.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Not sure why this place is worth waiting over an hour for. I think there are plenty of brunch places around that spending 1 hr 1/2 of your day loitering around isn't worth it. Maybe if you live nearby it may work (you can always go home and comeback) but I wouldn't make any effort driving here from outside of Potrero Hill. 

Food is OK. Nothing amazing at all. If you are willing to get in your car or any car...try Mission Beach Cafe or Universal Cafe. You will get more value out of your meal and not waste your time standing around the street for some ridiculous amount of time. Also the staff can be abrupt and rude. If people are willing to wait to try your food... the least you can do is be gracious and thankful. 

Service can be improved. Not worth the wait for ok food and serious attitude.
author: Tonia D.

description:
I remember adding Plow to my Yelp bookmarks about a year ago, and laughing at this photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=AQQHQEMRFHofOnyRFOBWCA&utm_campaign=www_photo_share_popup&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_source=(direct)

"Silly San Franciscans," I thought. I mean, brunch is great and all, but I wouldn't think twice before opting out of a rain-soaked meal.

Then my boyfriend and I went to Plow this past weekend. Waited 2 hours in line. (Actually, drank coffee and read magazines at Farley's down the street to help pass the time.) Was finally seated! And ordered the following:

+ Buttermilk biscuit with honey butter
+ The Plow
+ Fried egg sandwich with bacon and avocado

IT WAS ALL DELICIOUS. Usually, I find brunch spots specialize in making one item their "thing," but everything we ordered was incredible. The buttermilk biscuit was crunchy on the outside, and the honey butter that came with it? I'd bathe in it, if I could. The Plow potatoes were ORGASMIC. (I usually hate using this word, but I don't know how else to describe those taters.) The house made pork sausage patties were as flavorful as a mudder fudger. The fried egg sandwich was a no brainer. And don't even get me started on the lemon ricotta pancakes.

And, the staff was great! The host didn't even get annoyed that we switched back and forth between indoor seating and "first available" three times.

So, yeah. I'll be back... with an umbrella and raincoat, if necessary.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Ok, so the wait on a weekend can be excruciating..but! It is so very much worth it. First, the staff are quite friendly and everyone seemed to be happy working, which just adds to the ambiance. I am a firm believer that food made with love cannot be beat. This place has the love to make you feel like you just received a huge bear hug from a long lost friend.

I had the Chicken Tinga and it was absolutely divine. The eggs were perfectly scrambled, the crispy tortillas, the red sauce (like an enchilada sauce but thicker and richer) were fantastic with the slices of avocado. Overall...amazing! I ordered a side order of sausage to try it, it was ok but definitely not needed with the main dish. 
 
My vote: Go! It will be well worth the wait, I promise.
author: Tina B.

description: The fried egg sandwich was the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had! I don't quite know what they put on the bread but I was excited for every bite! Definitely worth the wait!
author: Kelsey S.

description:
This might be my favorite breakfast/brunch place in SF. I've been here a couple times, and it does not disappoint. Although many of the reviews comment on how long the wait typically is, if you go during the week, the wait is not nearly as long (I've never had to wait over 15 min which sounds crazy compared to what most reviews mention). However, it is still very crowded even during the week day, so expect to wait a little bit and make sure your entire party is present. 

Parking is essentially just street parking around the area. As expected, it can be a bit tricky in SF some times, but there usually seems to be spots relatively close by.

They have indoor and outdoor seating, with a nice comfortable feel to the interior. Seating is a bit cramped inside, but doesn't feel uncomfortable. Although there is only one bathroom, it is nice that it is clean and tidy.

The service was very friendly from the moment we walked in to our actual table service. 

Like many others, I have had the plow. The portion size is pretty generous. The lemon ricotta pancakes are as good as everyone mentions in their reviews. The plow potatoes are also nice and crispy and well seasoned. I also had the chicken apple sausage, which was another plus to this dish. 

We also had the french toast, which was surprisingly thick yet cooked nicely all the way through. The strawberries were fresh and, when topped with the syrup, was a perfect sweet start to the day.

I've also had the breakfast sandwich which was also delicious. Adding the bacon to it made it even better (obviously!). 

All in all, great breakfast/brunch place in SF. Be prepared to wait (especially if you go on the weekend), and it is a little pricey, but the food, service and ambiance will not disappoint!
author: Marc H.

description: This is my favorite place to have brunch in SF. It's a little bit difficult because everyone wants to have brunch there so you should call before and make an reservation. The food is simple but delicious. I do recommend xoxo
author: Guta P.

description: I visited this place on a Saturday morning around 10:30am. Wow, the wait was long...1.5 hours long. The weather was nice that day so standing around wasn't an issue. Once seated I ordered coffee and The Plow for an entree; it was delicious. Homemade sausage patties, scrambled eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy smashed potatoes with rosemary. It was worth the wait.
author: Michael C.

description:
Lately my best friend and I have been on a brunch craze and I've been wanting to try this place. We finally did!

I have known this place to be somewhere with a good hour or so wait especially on weekends. A popular thing people seem to do is put their name on the waitlist, and then wander off in the neighborhood for some coffee or pre-brunch snack. We waited about an hour and a half for a table inside. Due to high demand, it's possible you will be seated at a "community" table. Make friends with strangers, woohoo!

Now onto the food, it seems they change their menu based on what's available during the season and what is popular. I got The Plow which comes with two eggs (over medium for me), potatoes (which are REALLY good, by the way), two lemon ricotta pancakes (which are amazing!) and a choice of their housemade sausages or bacon ($16.50). My friend got the salmon benedict ($18)with potatoes, and we shared two pieces of their french toast with carmelized apples and mascarpone ($11.50) Fluffy, I have to admit! All in all, the food is delicious and filling. 

I would come back for their lemon ricotta pancakes for sure! Their brunch is a little on the pricey side of things, but it's worth trying. I pretty much stayed full for the rest of my day.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Heard good things about this place from a friend living in SF. 

I thought I would try it out on a Monday morning and there was STILL a line here. Luckily we were okay with sitting outside and did not have to wait for a table for two. They also provide throw blankets when it is colder outside. 

We ordered the steak and eggs, plow breakfast and a side of Hong Kong toast. 

My steak was good, but THOSE POTATOES. So delicious, especially with a little spicy ketchup. I thought the meat was a little overcooked from the medium rare I ordered but tasty nonetheless. The side of Hong Kong Toast was a must order for me as I love condensed milk based desserts. I was able to try the lemon ricotta pancakes and thought they alone would make for a very satisfying breakfast. 

If you can get here and not wait too long then I think you would be very satisfied with your meal. If the wait is 1 hour + I think you might be better off going somewhere else. This is not to say the food isn't excellent and worth the expected high prices, but I just on principle don't wait an hour or more for food.
author: Harry S.

description:
I really enjoyed Plow for brunch. Now that wait can be quite disappointing, especially since there's not much you can do around there to kill time. I brought my dog out that day and since the wait was 45 mins and we told them inside or out, whichever was first available was fine with us. Since we had time to kill, we took the pup to a dog park near by in dog patch area. But I hear there's a coffee shop not too far. We came back just in time and our table was ready as they quoted around 45 mins. 

I got their fresh squeezed orange juice. yummmmm, very refreshing. I ordered their fried egg sandwich, really good. The egg was perfectly cooked and runny. It was kinda messy, but delicious. The bf got the crab scramble which he really enjoyed. We shared the lemon ricotta pancakes, it was over hyped for me wasn't bad, but wasn't as good as I had expected.

Now the highlight, why it's really worth the wait. Their potatoes, those CRISPY POTATOES. Nice crispy on the outside and fluffy potato goodness on the inside. They come out real hot too. I LOVE POTATOES and to me, they're definitely worth the wait.

Service was decent. Didn't have anything to really complain about. Food came out a bit slow.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Dude..... listen.... everyone do yourself a favor and get the almond flour pancakes !!!! That is all (drops )
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Plow has been on my "bookmarked" list for quite some time. I've been wanting to go here for so long but I always end up backing out due to the long line. But there's something so catchy about Plow that further ignited my curiosity. Number one...long lines. Number two...great reviews. And number three...the pictures on Yelp look amazing!

Finally I was able to pay a visit with a few friends from SoCal after picking them up from a 7am bus ride from LA. Since we were there around 7:30am, we were seated very quickly. It wasn't empty...but wasn't packed either.

Ambience: Very relaxed. It's like waking up and stepping into a friend's kitchen while being strikened with a whiff of bacon and eggs cooking in the background. It's not huge but just right. I love how the tables are wooden...it provides the perfect touch to my pics for Instagram and Yelp lol.

Food: So many choices to choose from! I wanna try the Corned Beef Hash, the Egg Sandwich, and the Crab Scramble on my next visit.  But for starters, I had to get "The Plow". What a huge serving! You get two eggs, crispy potatoes, chicken sausage, & lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are so good! Perfectly crisp and seasoned with salt and rosemary. It went well with the runny egg yolks and chicken sausage. But I was surprised at the lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm usually not a lemon-flavored pastry type of person but the pancakes were so fluffy from the ricotta and refreshing and light from the lemon. I think they used just the lemon zest because they seemed perfumed with a lemon essence that I fell in love with.

Overall Plow is a great place for breakfast. It's a little small so it's intended for smaller groups. Parking isn't too bad either...primarily residential parking spots. Just be patient and you'll eventually find one. I'll admit it's not the cheapest breakfast spot but it's totally worth every penny. I can't wait for my next visit.
author: Ralph N.

description:
This is the cutest little breakfast cafe! They seem to always be busy and I'm not sure if they take reservations, so be prepared to wait about 15 minutes or so. The wait is worth it, I promise! 

I had the soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, goat cheese plow fried potatoes, toast AND bacon. This entire plate of deliciousness for less than $15 and washed down with an equally delicious coffee. 

My boyfriend and his sister each ordered "The Plow," which came with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, plow fried potatoes and sausage. You can choose between chicken apple sausage, pork sausage or bacon. I can't recall what sausage they chose, but I do remember it having a bit of a spicy kick to it. The lemon ricotta pancakes tasted a little much like a cookie to me..I will probably try their featured pancakes next time. When we went they were pumpkin pancakes, and had I the room, I would have ordered them as well.

My coffee cup was always as full as the tummy I left with. Great, friendly service. I will definitely be back to try more items!
author: Kate A.

description: Reliably excellent.  Good service and well prepared breakfast favorites.  Familiar but with a unique twist in each.
author: J B.

description: Not only is the food here delicious, the service is like nothing else I've experienced during my time here in San Francisco. Everyone was so friendly and genuine and my food came out fast despite being there on a busy Sunday morning during brunch.
author: Morgan R.

description:
Overall, really good and would recommend to anyone. Lots of items I'd like to try on the menu. 

Food - Got prosciutto toast with potatoes and a side of bacon. All were very good. Toast is thick but easy to eat. 

Service - Long wait but interesting things to do while waiting. Once we were seated, staff was attentive and food came out on time. 

Ambiance - Sat at the counter. Played great music (90s rap and R&B). Fun watching the chefs prep the food. Has an upscale diner feel.
author: Alex R.

description: I was extremely excited for this place and I couldn't stop looking at the pictures on yelp. My friends and I came here on a Tuesday and we waited close to an hour for a table of 3. The hostess was also rude and the vibe we got from her was kind of snobby. Once we got seated we were served fairly quickly. We all ordered the The Plow and got our food in about 15 minutes. Right away we noticed that the portions seemed way smaller than in the pictures from previous yelp reviews which was annoying cause the entree was $17. The lemon ricotta pancakes were not fluffy or good. The eggs were unseasoned. To be honest, the best part of the dish were the potatoes which were not even that good. I felt like I wasted my money and time.
author: Cynthia L.

description: Amazing food. Breakfast potatoes the best I've ever had. They managed the line well and there was a convenience store right there to grab a drink if you like.
author: Ryan W.

description: Service was average and the food was okay. I ordered take out because there was a long line. I had to see what all the fuss was about their pancakes. The potatoes are amazing tried their house made sausage with poached eggs aka the plow for $17$$. I'm on the fence about giving them 4stars. I will go back again and dine in. I feel like take out is never as good as dining  in. I'm also like 17$ for two small pancakes sausage patties potatoes and eggs feels over priced. However the place stays packed. The French toast looks amazing will come back and try that next
author: Andre F.

description:
Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day so while visiting the bay area, my bf and I HAD  to find a good breakfast spot. This place opens up at 8am on Sunday and we got there a couple minutes past 8 and there was a huge line already. That was a good sign of a great breakfast to come. We waited like an hour but it didn't bother us because you can people watch and sip complimentary coffee while you wait. 

Finally I hear my name being called and personally I think we got the best seats in the place, counter seats. We were in awe at how fast the cooks made everything. We both ordered the Plow and loved it! The potatoes could of used a bit more seasoning but were still great. I had fresh grapefruit juice and it was a nice addition to my morning. Overall we really enjoyed Plow.
author: Evelia T.

description:
Waited for 45 minutes on a Saturday at 1pm. That was fine with me. I was offered water or coffee while I waited which was cool.

The place gets packed and they try to fit as many people as possible in tiny tables like as if it was Tetris. The small table and area was fine with me.

I ordered a side of the the lemon ricotta pancake, I highly recommend ordering it. It was sooo good and I don't even like pancakes, but I seen how popular they were in peoples reviews. I also ordered the mushroom and spinach eggs benedict, which was very good as well except for the fact that I had to spit out my food because there were a good amount of egg shells in my benedict. I drop egg shells in my eggs sometimes, but I always pick them back out. The cook must have been blind or just plain careless. There's just no excuse for egg shells in a cooked meal.
author: Christina O.

description: AMAZING restaurant!! For anyone who's ever been snobby about brunch because it's easy to make eggs at home... I DARE you to eat here and not fall in love with everyone on the menu. Obsessed with the biscuits, anything on toast, and salads. And if nothing else, it's worth the trip just for their fried potatoes. My tiniest criticism is that (like all great restaurants), the quality of the food seems to have dropped slightly since when it first opened, which is a bummer. I've been a regular here for 4 years and my last visit wasn't quite up to the consistent standards the restaurant has upheld for so long. But even on a bad day, Plow is still by far the best breakfast in town!
author: Erin L.

description:
Amazing place! Went for a run from twin peaks to plow, the wait was about 1hr40 min, which is typical. The hosts were cool, they put up with "mr questions"(me)... 

Finally grabbed a seat next to this really eurotrashy group, who tried seating 5 at a 4 top...(trump executive order?)...one of the members got kicked out for being trumpy towards one of the busboys. 

The waitstaff was awesome and I felt bad they had to deal with such rude patrons. 

The food came out: we ordered lemon ricotta pancakes, a breakfast sandwich and French toast. All of the food items were awesome! I couldn't stop eating. 
If I were to go back I'd order the same items again!
author: Anonymous T.

description:
It's no joke that you usually have to wait 1.5-2 hours to get a spot at this small but delicious brunch spot in potrero. It's just something that most San Franciscans do on a weekend morning, wait in line for one of the famous brunch places in the area. I've done it before and I'll do it again - although the wait seems far too long, Plow is mouth-watering good! 

Right on the 2-hour mark, our name was called and we were so excited to finally sit down and eat! For 3, we ordered the plow (they substitute avocado instead of meat if you're vegetarian), summer melon salad, almond flour pancakes, and the cornbread muffin. It was a LOT of food! 

My favorites were the plow and the summer melon salad. The plow was the perfect dish for breakfast: 2 eggs, plow potatoes, and 2 mini lemon ricotta pancakes. If I were to go back again and get a dish solely for me, I would get this. The eggs were cooked perfects, the potatoes were just the right amount of crispy and had great seasoning, and the pancakes were soft, fluffy and just melted in your mouth. If you can't tell already, order this dish! There's definitely a reason it's named after the restaurant itself. The summer melon salad was beyond fresh and tasty. It had many crunchy melon pieces alongside lettuce, onions, cheese, and corn. I loved the combination of all these ingredients, but this is probably a supplement to your meal, I don't think this would fill you up.

The almond flour pancakes were just ok - they tasted more like regular pancakes to me and there wasn't really anything special about them. Same goes for the muffin, we honestly just ordered this because they told us they were running out of them and there was only a limited quantity so we had some high hopes. I didn't really like the texture of the muffin and the taste was just ok as well. 

Service is great even though they're busy for at least 7 hours straight (7am-2pm). If you're willing to wait, go here! It's some good quality, hearty, delicious brunch food. I wish there was a shorter wait so I could keep going back again and again.
author: Malika R.

description:
Absolutely delicious! They have a cozy interior and THE most amazing buttery biscuits served with even more delicious honey butter. And yes, "cozy interior" is also a euphemism for "you will wait a very, very long time." 

Tip #1: There's a decent amount of street parking in the area - lots of 90 degree parking within a few blocks of Plow. 

Tip #2: It gets crowded. I've gone on a Saturday and Sunday around 9am, and both times the wait is about 1 hour. There's a few coffee shops right down the street, so you can grab some coffee while you wait. You won't lose your spot if you're called Otherwise, if you're waiting outside the restaurant, bring a warm jacket, because there's limited outdoor heating.

Tip #3: The food is all delicious, but I especially love the egg sandwich. Perfectly cooked eggs sandwiched in a delicate bun... Mmmm!  Beware of the drip - my jeans almost fell victim to the gooey yolk. 

Overall: If you have some time to kill, it's a fantastic brunch spot.
author: Sarah W.

description: Plow fell short of my expectations. We got there at 8:05ish and the wait was an hour (expected). What is nice about them is that you can get beverages while you wait for your name to be called. I heard one of the hostesses call a party of 2 that was after us and ask if a shared table was okay and they agreed, soon after I found out it was going to be us they shared a table with. Picture this: a father and a teenage daughter sharing a table with a couple and a baby. Awkward. What was even more awkward was the fact that they didn't ask us if WE minded sharing a table right next to the entrance with complete strangers. It was honestly uncomfortable and unacceptable. The food is pretty pricey and not worth it. From looking at pictures, I expected more but as aforementioned, Plow sucked. In future visits, I will go elsewhere for breakfast.
author: Itati V.

description: Incredible lemon ricotta pancakes, flaky biscuits, solid bacon and sausage as a unique French toast made for one of the best breakfasts I've had. I hope to return next trip to the Bay Area.
author: Liam H.

description: Delicious food and a nice ambiance for a breakfast place, right down to the reggae music quietly jamming out of the kitchen area. My brother would punch me if I didn't make mention of the toast, he'll probably punch me anyways.  I found out it's sourced from a bakery called Acme, we may have to pay them a visit as their bread with just some butter spread on it was like ambrosia from the gods. =)
author: Jay D.

description: I finally got plowed! My boyfriend and I were working from home one day so we decided to check out Plow. We arrived before 8am and lucky for us there was NO wait! Once inside, I instantly fell in love with the ambiance and cozy decor. On the menu, the Plow is a great choice since it comes with a variety of items. I ordered my eggs over-easy and it was cooked PERFECTLY! The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious and had the perfect texture.The potatoes were super fried and seasoned well, really tasty. Overall, great food and friendly service. Is it worth the 1+ hour wait? I'm not sure... but it is the best brunch place we have been to so far in the city if that helps. Tip: Go on early on a weekday to avoid the crowds!
author: Lynn T.

description: The coffee, the plow, the service was absolutely superb! This will be a regular stop for us when in San Fran.
author: Rebekah S.

description: Great atmosphere, great service, delicious food. Prepare yourself for a long wait, and grab a coffee at Provender down the street to make it feel shorter. The lemon ricotta pancakes are can't-miss, but the breakfast sandwich was the surprise favorite in our group.
author: Celie H.

description: Good breakfast! The potatoes were the best part - crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. I enjoyed my breakfast sandwich as well. The coffee was just black coffee, we were hoping for more choices in coffee department but that was the only real let down! We also split a piece of french toast which was decent. Nothing was outstanding but nothing was bad. Would go again for breakfast.
author: Kathleen D.

description:
My favorite breakfast spot in SF...always busy and for good reason.  Expect to wait...but be patient.  The food speaks for itself.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are the winner winner for me...as part of "the plow", you also get eggs, I chose chicken apple sausage, and potatoes.  Delish.  I could've just done the pancakes alone.  We also ordered the shirred eggs.  Something about tomatoes and eggs that get me everytime.  

The place is small, quaint, and very clean.  Service is friendly and efficient.  Love, love, love this place!
author: Jen W.

description:
One of the best breakfast/brunch places I've had. The only downside is the wait can be very long, try to come on a weekday around 10am seems to be the least crowded.

Order The Plow for breakfast and have their blueberry muffin if available.
author: Yousif A.

description: I was driving by Plow at 1 on a Tuesday afternoon (about 1pm) on my way home from an appointment in Potrero Hill. There was no line outside the door like there usually is so I had to park and take advantage of the opportunity to check out the hype. I have to say Plow lived up to all my expectations. I ordered the custard French toast with fresh strawberries and it was pretty tasty. The service was great with great ambience (rustic, high ceilings, clean) I would recommend coming here midweek but would never come near this place on a weekend. Otherwise, thumbs up on the entire experience!
author: Liz O.

description:
Soft scrambled eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes, great service...need I say more?? I was worried that Plow had been over hyped but I'm happy to say that I wasn't disappointed! Even on a Friday there was a line of people waiting to get in during lunch, but we put our name down and waited maybe 45 minutes before getting seated in the back. Our server was friendly and the food came out pretty quickly!

The lemon ricotta pancakes were SO tender and moist, and the soft scrambled eggs were the perfect consistency to spread on my toast! I also loved the open, airy decor in Plow. I would definitely love to go again, but I recommend not going TOO hungry because the wait could be pretty long!
author: Grace C.

description: I live in the neighborhood but this is my first time to eat here. The long line always discouraged me to come here. Today I woke up early and decided to try and witness what the buzz is all about. I got "The Plow" as recommended for first timers since it has everything. I love the lemon pancakes and the bacon. Will definitely come back. Btw we arrived at 9am and waited for 40mins.
author: mel m.

description: one word. excellent!  Highly recommend the lemon ricotta pancakes as it it comes in a platter w fluffy eggs and great bacon.  Will come back for sure
author: Kris P.

description:
Brunch is a meal I often dream about. That's when I knew I had to check out this popular brunch place. I came in during a weekday, to avoid the weekend rush, and only waited 10 minutes for indoor seating. The place is pretty small and our tavle of three had to squeeze into a table set normally for two. After glancing over the menu, I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich because eggs are egg-celent in my book. The other two ordered the Plow and the Dungeness Crab Omelette. The food took a while to come, around 15-20 minutes. Nevertheless the presentations were nice. We ended up sharing a majority of our dishes.

I ended up really liking my dish. The egg was warm and runny and the bread had a soft, crunchy texture. However, the best component of my dish were the house potatoes.  Mmmm... mouth watering and crispy, a reminiscent of french fries. These potatoes were out of this world!

In regards to the other dishes, I didn't really like the omelette  and the Plow was good but not spectacular. I really enjoyed the lemon ricotta pancakes. Overall the food impressed but was a little on the pricy side.  Good thing everything came in big portions! Will hopefully be back soon
author: Jessica E.

description:
Brunch in San Francisco is the best and Potrero Hill has the best parking in all of San Francisco. I found an unmetered street parking spot within a few minutes of spotting the restaurant. 

The wait for breakfast early in the morning on the weekend was one hour but it was worth it. I ordered The Plow and the eggs and potatoes were my favorite parts of the dish. Best eggs and potatoes I've ever eaten! The lemon ricotta pancakes were good but I think I was a little too full to enjoy them as much as I should have. I probably wouldn't order the sausage again. Highly recommend coming here if you have two hours to kill for breakfast!
author: Karen L.

description: If you are a brunch lover, this is the place to go. Incredible food, that's definitely worth the wait. I usually judge brunch places by their Eggs Benedict and Plow's version was one of the best I've had. They included crispy potatoes on the side that were to die for. I also recommend getting their seasonal chia pudding, which is creamy and delicious and served with local fruit on top.
author: Emily G.

description: Great breakfast. We sat outside,so the wait was short. Service was good food was excellent. Definitely will come here again.
author: Erin M.

description:
This is probably one of the best breakfast/brunch places in SF. I got here around 740 on a Saturday and was seated immediately when they opened. Keep in mind, I was maybe 10th in line and there was a huge line behind me before 8AM. 

The coffee was just okay. Nothing too special. I ordered the Plow breakfast. It consists of eggs, a meat, potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes. Te best part of the dish was the lemon ricotta pancakes!! So moist (I hate that word but had to use it) and delicious! I selected the house made sausage...definitely a winner! Try this even if you don't like sausage! The potatoes were perfectly seasoned and crispy. I could have an entire plate of this. It was a very large plate overall but totally worth the money! 

I'll be back to try more items.
author: Alysa N.

description:
I have been waiting to try Plow out because of it's ratings and reviews here on Yelp, and the fact that I have seen the name in numerous sources. Came to Plow on a saturday morning with my friend. We decided to brunch and catch up before she headed back to school. We waited a good 2 hours before we were finally seated, so either bring something to do, or get ready for some good conversations with your group. 

Ambiance/ Appearance:
Plow is located in Potrero Hill and it felt very hipster and homey. Plow is on the corner, which is a good thing because it needs all the waiting area space it can provide. There is a few tables of outdoor seating on the side of the restaurant. Inside, there aren't too many tables, so most likely you will have to share with others. There was a slight rustic feel inside, but it felt very lively because of the music and background conversations. 

Service:
The service is excellent. Servers and staff are super nice and made sure you felt comfortable.

Taste: 
Both my friend and I ordered the plow which consisted of a choice of meat, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, and crispy potatoes. Let me just say, the wait is totally worth it. My friend and I felt indifferent about the meat (she got the chicken apple sausage and I got the homemade pork sausage). I thought the sausage was kind of dry and was over it because everything else on the plate shined brighter. The pancakes are sooo good. They are cakey and moist, and just heavenly. The potatoes, were some of the best potatoes I have ever had. They were super crispy and seasoned well. It had some shallots or onions and other herbs. 

With tax and tip, I think it came out to $20. Overall the food was bomb dot com! I would totally return again (but probably not on a weekend or at later times in the day to avoid the wait). Even with the wait, it is totally worth trying out. I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!
author: Vivian Y.

description:
Let's start off by saying the Plow potatoes were by far my favorite part of my meal. 

Food:
-Ordered the Plow breakfast which comes with lemon ricotta pancakes, your choice of protein, potatoes, and eggs. I also ordered a rolled Jasmine tea.

The portion size is huge, so I couldn't finish everything but that works if you'd like some leftovers.

Atmosphere:
-The place is well decorated meaning colors are soothing and match the wood theme throughout the place. 

The music is a little odd. Blend of house and jazz. 

Parking:
-There are side streets to park but no parking lot that belongs to the restaurant. 

Wait times:
-The place is small so be prepared to wait. Especially on the weekends. They have small benches to sit on outside while you wait so you won't have to stand. 

Cleanliness:
-The place as a whole is very clean, including the restroom. However there is only a single stall for both men and women. 

Overall a great brunch place.
author: Chhaya N.

description: Holy cow the biscuit! Probably the best item and most memorable though we tried the ricotta lemon pancakes and The Plow- all enjoyable brunch food. We abided the crowds and although the ambiance is quite enjoyable not sure I'd wait for a table with a long line... but those biscuits... yum
author: J K.

description:
It was good, but expensive: $22 for 'the plow' and a cup of coffee, plus tip. 

Service was great, the food was good, and the waiting to be seated certainly sucks, but that's not their fault.

I'd give 3.5 stars.
author: Andrew M.

description:
DEFINITELY got lucky. Among ~10 breakfast spots in the city, this was our pick. And we left satisfied. 

Came on a weekday @1PM and there was only a 15min wait. Easy...we went for a walk and checked out the shops in the vicinity. Table was ready in no time. (~10 tables, half indoors/half outdoors)

We got the Plow so we could try a little of everything. Variety is the spice of life and all that shizz. Came with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and choice of meat. Not bad for $16!

So the food...Let's start with the NEGATIVES. 1. Compared to the banana pancakes at Bill's Cafe in SJ (A+), the pancakes are on the smaller side. And as we all know, #biggerisbetter...always. BUT if you're #qualityoverquantity, flavor is just right...enough lemony goodness without being overpowering.

2. Baked goods were all out by the time we got there. +They must be damn delicious! -Get there early (definitely before noon)

The POSITIVES. The eggs were perfect..let's be real, it's hard to get eggs wrong. Potatoes were nice and crispy. Now the meat. For all you meatatarians, if you're not a bacon lover, please do yourself a favor and go with the pork sausage. I love me some bacon but after tasting my sister's pork sausage, I spent the whole meal secretly wishing I could steal her plate. Don't make the same mistake.

Overall, a memorable breakfast. I'll be back!
author: Aerin Y.

description: This place is small, and of course, being SF, there's a line up the hill at 8 am on a Sunday.  Fortunately, our group of 5 just made the first seating to grab the last table.  The breakfast sandwich was loaded and tasty, loved the potatoes.  The biscuits and gravy so-so, biscuit had a slightly sweet taste.  The combo looked good, complete with eggs, potatoes, meat and lemon-ricotta pancakes.  Overall, everything we had was delicious, fresh and good.        I'm just at a stage in my life where I have little patience waiting in line for food.
author: Kristin U.

description: I have never given a 1 star review....ever.  I was so excited to try this place, such awesome reviews and even more awesome pictures.  Arrived and already tons of people outside waiting to be seated.  The place is pretty small and chaotic.  Checked in with the hostess who kind of just blew me off and wasn't very friendly said the wait would be 2 hours.  Yes, 2 hours.  I knew there would be a wait, and everyone said "it's worth the wait." Well I made the mistake of saying yes, I'll wait.  So I put in my name for a a table of 4.  Checked in at 11:25.  There ends up being a ton of no shows due to the wait times.  Several names get called as they cross off names.  So I thought positively, and told myself there's no way this will take 2 hours.  Several other groups continuously check in.  It was a beautiful sunny day so we didn't mind the wait.  After an hour, our stomachs started growling. At about 12:15 we asked the hostess again how is the wait list looking, again very rude, short, and snappy and said "your name is on the list, it won't be long."  So we wait and we wait, we hear a group of 4 next to us (who checked in about 45 mins after us) say they know the hostess and the wait won't be long.  To my surprise they were seated before us.  There were several groups who checked in after us, and got seated before us.  I was with my pregnant friend as well, who I'm sure you can imagine was very hungry.  Around 1:30 we checked in again and the hostess snapped and said didn't I tell you you're on the list.  She was so rude and awful.  We waited so long because we heard the food was worth it.  After the awful service and ridiculous wait time we finally got in the car at 1:45pm and left, mind you, they close at 2pm.  So very disappointed about my awful experience there.  Really hope they teach their hostess some manners.  They also should consider figuring out a better way to take down names.  I'm sure if you are in a party of just 2 you'll be fine.
author: Adrianna P.

description:
Service: Hard to say since I sat at the "bar" with my Mom and watched the cooking.
Atmosphere: I went on a weekday morning and it was still packed. You will have to wait and it will be crowded, but it doesn't seem like it gets too loud and a great option is to sit at the "bar".
Drink: I got whole milk since I wanted to indulge a tad and my mother got a homemade juice that was refreshing.  I would stick to caffeinated drinks and save all of your stomach for the food.
Food: Delicious. Come with an empty stomach and be sure to try the lemon pancakes. I got the Plow, which is a fair amount of food, but my plate was wiped clean at the end and I even picked at my Mom's bacon, which was crunchy, fatty and great. I highly recommend the Plow. 
Overall: One of the better breakfasts/brunches I have had. Come hungry and leave happy, full and a little heavier. I can't imagine the wait on the weekends, so try coming off peak hours because you cannot make reservations.
author: George S.

description: This is where SF couples go for breakfast! They got some really great sandwiches on the menu - following the classic recipes but adding their own twist. A real winner are the baked potatoes, they are soo good!
author: Tim B.

description:
SERVICE//
Three words: Randall is awesome. 

AMBIANCE//
-This place is tiny. There is outside seating and indoor seating. Inside there are only about six tables. I personally preferred indoor seating because outdoor seating is next to everyone who is waiting and the food gets cold faster!
-We waited for 1.5 hours. Make sure your entire party is there!
-There are some cute seats along the restaurant for people waiting, but definitely not enough for the huge crowd.
-There is only ONE single stall UNISEX bathroom. That is not enough for this restaurant! Especially with the long line. You have to eye the bathroom like a hawk in order to get in there and its behind this weird curtain. 

FOOD//
-Free coffee while you wait, with cream and sugar in super cute cups! That's so nice! But the wait is super long. 
-Get the lemon ricotta pancakes! Do not get them in a combo because it won't be enough! Get a whole plate of these bad boys!
-The tomato sandwich was BOMB. The tomatoes were so good they were practically sweet!
-Everything else was pretty standard. 

I like this place. But, I almost thought that I was at Kitchen Story, the set up is VERY similar: street corner at the bottom of a steep hill, long line, great for breakfast/brunch. Kitchen story has an Asian flare, with its millionaire's bacon and fabulous french toast. I hope that Plow can give Kitchen Story a run for its money, especially now that this area in SF is getting more developed. But, like everything else in SF this is steep, total $70 for three people.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I recently had to drop someone off at the airport at 5:30am. Now, I don't live anywhere near Plow, or the airport, and while I could have gone home and beaten all of the traffic back... I could also choose to hang out in the city for an hour and a half, and wait for Plow to open. 

So of course I waited for them to open their doors. 

And as always it was worth it! 

Service is a bit ... apathetic at times, but given the tiny space they have to fit everyone in to and work in, I don't really blame them - and they are always capable and responsive to my crazy requests.

The food is great, with lots of options for everyone (love their gluten free pancakes). Though I tend to stick to the GF side of the tracks, I've been tempted and many of my compadres have eaten just about everything else on the menu and loved it!

Go early or expect a wait, any day of the week.
author: Lila H.

description: To start with everyone was super friendly and efficient. They didn't leave us waiting for long and were quick to take and bring out our orders. The dish I got (prosciutto and gruyere toast) was delicious and nothing overpowered the other too much. The dish was balanced and I thought was amazing. My friends also raved about their dishes. We all tried the buttermilk biscuit, Mochi cake, and Hong Kong style toast which were all amazing. The buttermilk biscuit is better suited with breakfast but the other two would have been a great way to end a meal. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here. I recommend this place to everybody!
author: Nicky P.

description:
This place serves some legit breakfast eats. I ordered the plow which comes with their spiced potatoes, eggs, lemon griddle cakes, and your choice of sausage or bacon. Its pretty simple but executed very well. My lady ordered the breakfast sandwich with Bacon and it also comes with eggs, potatoes too. It was also very good though not a very different of a dish at all so if you wanted to try something new, I think you would need to order something else. 

Its a small place and gets extremely crowded so plan accordingly. Even during a weekday you might wait close to an hour for a table. There are a number of coffee shops nearby though. Parking was pretty easy on the cross street but can imagine it might get difficult during a busy weekend. Overall, I really enjoyed this place and would go back if I had the time.
author: Huy V.

description: Waited literally 3 hours for a party of 4. Food was really good, but not worth the wait. I realize they have the demand to keep going- but I'll never go back- wasted half the day for some eggs and bacon haha. Only in SF. They need to figure out a more organized system to handle the wait list or they won't have repeat customers.
author: Drew C.

description: Go here if you want to wait 2 hours only then to receive rude and pretentious service and treatment.
author: Joshua G.

description:
Simple. Carefully made. Local.

First time to Plow with colleagues. We started with a round of grapefruit mimosas. They were fantastic and don't skimp on the champagne.

We shared a biscuit with homage butter and it was to die for. I could make a meal of those biscuits.

I had the plow which included potatoes (a bit overfried and standard tasting), eggs (scrambled done perfectly) chicken sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes.

The pork sausage is way better than the chicken.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are the most delicious thing I have ever tasted. Next time I'll get those with a side of sausage.

Service was good. Menu was delightfully small. Wait on a Friday morning was pretty long. Get in early.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Really really good breakfast spot! My wife and I got the Plow & Egg Benedict, both were amazing :)

Make sure you have plenty of time dropping by, both times we passed by there was a long line waiting outside. We waited around 30min, but it was totally worth the wait
author: Alex K.

description: If I could go to breakfast everyday here, I would. The food, drinks, and customer service was amazing!! Such a great place!
author: Sarah W.

description: Came here on a Wednesday morning around 9AM, and there was no wait at all. Service was okay, and the menu was very limited. I chose the two egg breakfast with bacon, and my boyfriend ordered the pork chop and eggs. We also ordered two small cups of orange juice, which ran to about $9.50. The orange juice is not worth it!!! The highlight of our meal was the Hong Kong style toast and the pork chop. Plow was probably the most expensive brunch I've ever had in San Francisco.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Welp, we took the ongoing advice and got there early on a Sunday AM. Totally worth it. I knew we were onto something great when they had a person dedicated to the "list". That tells me a lot. This place cares about your experience from the minute you walk in. Plus she was super nice...and cute.
The food, well, was simply delicious. Maybe not up to the ultimate hype, but definitely very good. I had the Plow breakfast, which was incredibly filling, varied, and I ate every morsel of it, plus a side of potatoes. The table also ordered the lemon ricotta, the eggs Benny, and another item which I 'm forgetting. Even with the crowd and the slightly frenetic pace, the food is delivered with care, cooked just right, and served fairly quickly. Not sure how they do it, but it's impressive.
Wouldn't wait two hours for the food, but 30-45 minutes was worth it.
author: Mike C.

description: I mean, there's a reason people are willing to wake 2-3 hours for breakfast here, and it's not just their desire to embody the pretension of the San Francisco restaurant (specifically, brunch) scene. The food is great and the vibe is cute. But I am not sure it's worth the weekend wait. The lemon ricotta pancakes are solid (though not the best I've ever had) and the potatoes and crispy and delicious. If you want to put you name down on Sunday morning, then go get mimosas elsewhere for two hours, I say go for it. Or you are one of those people I envy that can "brunch" on a Wednesday (I hate you), also go for it.  The food is worth it. But if you're just looking (or in this city, desperately searching) for a place enjoy some quality brunch food on the weekend within 2 hours of the time you began this quest, I say skip it. Return when you've made your millions and can brunch on a Monday.
author: Katherine D.

description:
Okay this place has been in my bookmarks for probably a year and I never had the chance to go until today. And may I just say that Plow exceeded my expectations. They change the menu every day which I loveeee. They emphasize a farm-to-table sort of vibe which is refreshing to find in the city. Breakfast/brunch is my favorite meal so I'm always into trying out new places with something different on the menu. Plow definitely is that place. I ordered the chia seed pudding and then a side of two over easy eggs. The chia pudding was AMAZING. It came with honey, fruit and bee pollen on top which was a perfect compliment. It was quite light so it didn't really fill me up but the eggs did the trick. The waitress was the one who told me that it would not be that filling which was helpful. At the end of the pudding and eggs I was still sort of hungry but I was happy to not have been too full as that usually makes me feel uneasy. 

As for ambiance, Plow was very friendly. The design was minimalistic and simple which made me love it even more. The seating outside was very nice, although I sat inside. 

They don't take reservations, like many other brunch places in SF, so the wait was about an hour and a half but I just went to the coffee shop nearby to get a latte and it was all good. 

Definitely check this place out, it's worth it!!
author: Simi K.

description:
Great spot to land after my mini road trip.
Rachel was chill and on point.  Quaint spot in the DogPatch district.  Eclectic menu. 
Lemon Ricotta pancakes were also on point.
Love houses from the 'days of yore' that are converted into nice lil restaurants like this...
author: Matthew S.

description: Yes!!! Worth the wait no matter how long the line is! Great food, great vibe, great service. Get The Plow breakfast plate and get the amaaaazing coffee!
author: Wanda G.

description:
While I was visiting San Francisco late weekend, my friend took me here for brunch. Thanks to my friend who put her name on a wait list a couple of hours ahead, we were able to sit almost right after we showed up. 

I had 'the plow' that came with two eggs, potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and bacon. At first, they didn't look too different from other brunch place, but were x100 tastier!! The eggs were soft but perfectly cooked, and potatoes were well-seasoned and very crispy. I probably could have had 5 more pancakes. Lol. 

Our server was super friendly and attentive as well. Strongly recommended!
author: Julia C.

description:
I found out about this place because of their fried egg sandwich featured in "20 epic sandwiches to eat before you die if sf" but man o man, that is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the deliciousness of the food here.

I came here probably four more times within the course of a month after that initial visit. I've seen good California cuisine and good brunch places, but wow this place is phenomenal. I've tried their biscuits, pancakes, potatoes, eggs, and this AMAZING berry cake that they had. When I say amazing, I mean amazing... I've had some great berry tarts/cakes but this one has probably been the best one I've had this far in my life. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. And their other menu items are just as good. You can really taste the freshness and the fact that the ingredients are sourced by local vendors.

What's great is that their menu changes all the time so you can expect new delicious creations to come about every time you come here. What a great find in potrero hill!
author: Kunal N.

description:
Oh Plow, I'm starting to fall in love with you. I was forewarned by the Yelp reviews about how long the wait is, so each time I've been here, I made sure to try and get there shortly after they've opened to beat the hour long wait.

I'm writing my review based on my latest visit. I have a 10-month old baby who gets pretty fussy if he isn't kept entertained, so I'm always apprehensive about taking him with me when dining out. This past visit, my hubby, son, and I were seated at the bar. I love that their high chair attaches to the table. Our server was so friendly and engaged with the baby, which to me was a plus. Not to mention the hostess, who noticed that we were beginning to struggle with the baby. She brought over a little toy to keep him entertained so that was really sweet of her.

Now to the important part... the food. BOMB! We've tried the Plow with the lemon ricotta pancakes, the Hong Kong style toast, the egg sandwich with avocado, and the french toast. Everything we've ordered thus far has been delicious. The quality of the ingredients is great, even down to the cup of coffee.

I'll continue to frequent this place. Highly recommended for anyone who likes breakfast. Just as a head's up, come early to avoid the long wait.
author: Anne Y.

description:
Delicious!!!

Great food. Great staff. Great atmosphere. Great spot. 

I highly recommend this breakfast joint. This is a great neighborhood place. 

The staff was very friendly, kind and attentive. I split the plow plate with my mom and they were happy to provide and extra plate to do so, which I really appreciate. 

We went on this Wednesday morning a little before 8am and only had to wait about 15 mins. I would recommend getting your name in a few minutes before 8 since some people who were meeting each other for breakfast got there right at 8. 

The drip coffee from Plow was rich and flavorful. And the servers are great about keeping it full. 

The plow plate is well rounded and delicious. I enjoyed splitting it too. The lemon ricotta pancakes were rich but light. I would love to try them with be berry compote that comes with them when ordered alone. The potatoes were the real star of the dish they had rosemary on them but it wasn't overpowering and they were crispy but not greasy. The bacon was excellent! 

Definitely would come back!
author: Julia M.

description: There will be a good, long wait, but the staff handles it well, & the patrons all seem patient about it.  The food is clean, fresh, & tasty.
author: Matt L.

description:
High rating doesn't do this place justice. It is an OK place. With 3 hours wait on Sunday by the time I was served food I was so hungry I would rate anything highly just because its food. 

Seriously people grow up...
author: Anelya S.

description: Solid 4. Great food in a cool part of town. It gets really busy so there's usually a long wait, but it's worth it. There's a coffee shop across the street, so you can grab a cuppa while you wait for your table. Pricy though.
author: Keagan G.

description:
One of my new favorite brunch spots in the city. I went here on a Thursday around 11 with no reservation and waited for about 10 minutes. We were seated outside. It was a bit chilly but they offer blankets which is a nice perk. 

I ordered "The Plow" which was with 2 eggs, 4 chicken apple sausage, potatoes, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes. The pancakes were delicious- pretty strong on the lemon flavor. I also had a side of bacon, and shared the French toast for dessert.  

I enjoy the true "farm to table" vibe, which makes it worth the slightly higher price point. But for 3 entrees and one side, one mimosa and 1 orange juice, we paid $100 including the tip. 

I will definitely be back the next time I am looking for an excuse to treat my self, which will be sooner than later I am sure.
author: Taylor M.

description:
Good service, and amazing food!

It's a bit of a wait, but I think it's worth it. I had the smoked salmon eggs benedict with a side of bacon. Their crunchy potatoes are the main reasons why I want to come back next time I'm in town. Bay Area knows how to brunch!
author: M D.

description:
Ugh, the hype here is as real as it gets. Came for an early afternoon brunch on Sunday and because we came in so late, the wait was only around 15 minutes! Although I have heard nightmare tales about the wait here at peak hours so definitely try and come either really early or really late like us haha.

My friend and I both ordered The Plow, which I feel like everyone gets here haha, but for good reason!
