second:  i mentioned it briefly, but everything from their containers to their choice of water pitchers (or bottles, in their case) to their napkins - guh, this place is smartly decorated.  first impressions are everything, and they present a good one!  moreover, it helps in my anticipation to try what they have to offer.  nice sense of décor = must be good.  :P  (also, their website makes the minimalist in me extremely happy!  simplicity goes a long way, people.)

the first day, i ordered the plow with chicken apple sausage.  everything was great and filling, but i wasn't sold on the sausage.  same thing happened the second time i was there when i ordered their two eggs and tried the pork instead.  i don't know, i'm just not a big fan of it in general, though it never hurts to try on the off-chance i'm blown away.  the third day i ordered some sides, but it was enough for me.  oh, and on the second day, i had a bite of my friend's lemon ricotta pancakes.

!  so delicious!  i normally stray away from anything cheese-like in my sweet foods, but i was pleasantly surprised by it!  i think i saw another review here that said the size of these pancakes were small ...?    buh.  i don't know, man.  the pancakes were pretty huge.  then again, everyone has their own idea about what a perfect portion is, so no big deal.

lemon ricotta pancakes aside, the food is average breakfast fare that's touched up enough to set it apart.  i just have a tendency to gloss over the tiny details because i'm easily fascinated by little things (pretty sugar in cute ceramic!).

service is a bit hit-or-miss, depending on who's working.  they're nice (i'm reluctant to say this because it's a very distant kind of niceness) enough and attentive, frequently checking up on your table if you need coffee refills and the like (i haven't been there while it was really busy, so i'm not sure if it's any different during a rush) so it's not so much as a complaint as it is an observation for improvement.

better off as a 3.5 establishment, but i'm okay with rounding up for the memorable rush of excitement i had with my friends.  :]
author: Ashley F.

description:
PLOW=WOW

My son told me about a fabulous breakfast/brunch place in Potrero Hill.
Well, being that he is a foodie, and has great taste, I tried Plow, and I must say, it has become my favorite place for breakfast/brunch. I LOVE LOVE the location..a beautiful area of Potrero on 18th with great views of the city. Once inside plow, you automatically feel like you are in someone's living space--very open and cozy!
Maxine, the owner and fantastic chef is amazing! I have tried their DE-LISH ricotta pancakes, their incredible french toast, the wonderful scramble, with its mushroom and goat cheese, just MELTS in your mouth!
Speaking of mouth melting, I have had their Coffee cake( how can one get the rich taste of this cake without making it so heavy in texture--well Maxine has definitely performed a miracle!)
Speaking of more miracles, I had their raisin Brioche today that I was told Maxine made this morning--A BIG PLOW-WOW! 
I will keep going back for more, as I am going to try everything on their menu( minus the meats, as I am a vegetarian!)
They were reviewed in the SAN FRANCISCO MAGAZINE...3 stars...HOW great is that! and they deserve it!!!
ALYSSA, one of their supreme waitresses, is the best!
GO GO GO GO TO PLOW....You will have a great tasting, enjoyable, experience that you will want to repeat and repeat and repeat!
PLOW-A BUNGALLY  MOOOVALOUS!
author: Maura B.

description: The eggs benedict were great, perfectly cooked orbs of deliciousness perched on some tasty bread. The biscuits and gravy are okay. For a short wait on weekends don't go with more than one other person.
author: Derek G.

description: Craving a fried chicken sandwich from Bakesale Betty's but don't want to drive to the East Bay? The fried chicken sandwich from Plow can satisfy that craving if you are on in SF! Maxine (the owner) use to own Stem on 18th and Bell and Trunk...the cute flower and gift shops...but her roots where originally in the restaurant biz and I am glad she opened this nice brunch spot. My mom loves many of the brunch items. I am looking forward to trying more things from the menu on my next visit back! Food is good and the place is kid friendly too!
author: Camille S.

description: I know it's a minority point of view, but I had one of the worst breakfasts ever at Plow.  Seating at the counter was so crowded that it was like trying to eat on a subway car during rush hour. The potatoes were indeed crispy, but tasted heavily of rancid cooking oil.  I went prepared to be wowed, and was sorely disappointed.
author: Mary C.

description: Best recently-opened restaurant experience I've had in... possibly ever. Service was professional, fun and friendly. Everything was clean, and I mean even the water was filtered and the glasses and silverware were spotless. Food was perfectly executed. I had the two eggs - comes with sausage, potatoes, toast. Partner had the scramble of the day. We also ordered a biscuit, which came with local Potrero Hill honey - highly recommended. Coffee was a yummy dark roast from Equator, good enough that we plan to hunt the beans down ourselves, and service was prompt about refilling. The best part was the price: very reasonable for the quality, service and atmosphere. I hope to be back, but expect a long line to get in, as this place will surely grow in popularity.
author: Sam Z.

description:
Their potatoes are the best!   Don't know how they get them so soft and crunchy....soooo good.  I had the eggs benedict and was very satisfied.  Have to go back and try the rest of the menu as I couldn't make up my mind.  

Do try to get there early as the line gets long.  We arrived around 9:30 and were seated in about 20 minutes so it wasn't bad.
author: Ana O.

description: PLOW! omg, where do i even start. Im afraid to write this review because I know once I start talking about the amazing food Im definitely going to be craving it. First off, I am a breakfast potato FREAK. I literally found this restraunt by searching 'best breakfast potatoes' on yelp. And oh man did this place deliver! They are so good that I even order and extra side of them with my breakfast. I order the fried egg sandwhich with bacon every time I go and it is always cooked to perfection. My sister has had the pumpkin pancakes and my friend always gets the lemon pancakes and they both said they are excellent. I make it a point to go to this place EVERY time im in SF. Parking is always easy and there is a liquor store right across the street to get some 'beverages' while you wait outside. The wait is usually pretty long, Ive gone almost every day of the week and on weekends and its always pretty much the same but they do their best to get you seated quickly. Trust me, the wait is definitely worth it. Once you have those perfectly crispy golden potatoes in your mouth, youll understand why.
author: Jered T.

description: i ordered french toast, i never order french toast for breakfast. it's gotta say something right there...
author: Sandy P.

description: awesome eggs benedict & lemon ricotta pancakes
author: Joel G.

description: love this place.  beautiful bright space, the most delicious vittles perfect with the mimosas they offer!  yum!
author: Kimby T.

description: came here this morning. love the decor, wait staff was very attentive and quick. We were sat within 10 minutes and we were able to have coffee while we waited. The potatoes and eggs were really really good and I like that they get ingredients locally. The pancakes were not cooked long enough, but whatever, I didn't need to be eating pancakes anyways. Will be returning for sure!
author: Rachael F.

description: What a brunch! Plow offers a great menu. Honestly couldn't find a single item that didn't look appealing. I got the two egg breakfast, served with bacon, breakfast potatoes and toast. The potatoes were amazing. We sat at the bar seating and were able to watch the chef create each delectable dish. We went on a Sunday around noon and waited for about 30 mins (party of two). Great spot!
author: Aaron S.

description: What more can be said about Plow, absolutely my favorite breakfast/brunch spot in the city!  Max & Joel have done a fantastic job with this place!  Not only is the food freaking fantastic but great decor as well!
author: Jeff C.

description: Amazingly good. The pancakes and fried egg sandwich were both delectable. Try and make reservations if you can, otherwise you'll wait a bit for a table. Service is great, and was overall a fabulous experience. I'd definitely go again.
author: Valerie Y.

description: Plow was on my list of places to try while in San Francisco for a while, and on a recent trip to the city I finally got to go! I arrived around 9 am on a Sunday and there was about an hour wait, which was well worth it! They offered coffee for waiting customers which helped on a chilly morning. I ordered the Plow which features some of the favorites - eggs, choice of meat, crispy potatoes (which were to die for) and lemon ricotta pancakes. Very pleased with the service, food and ambiance Wish I lived there so I could go more often!
author: Katherine C.

description:
The food was good, but not worth a 45 minute wait in the cold San Francisco wind.  There is a cafe 1/2 a block away, but no other good place to wait outside.

I would come back on a weekday or first thing on a Saturday or Sunday.
author: C L.

description: I have been scoping this place out as it is on my way to/from work. Went on my own for brunch and got a seat at the counter right away! (groups, families, couples waiting) Waitress (Danielle) was attentive and sweet, cooks were intense and focused; the synergy between them was intriguing. But the food, ah the food was sublime. I had the plow, with bacon/scrambled eggs and there was much to savor. The eggs were ummm, potatoes OUTSTANDING and the bacon, I could have had a whole plate of the bacon by itself.  The space is airy & lightfilled, and the retained Edwardian details add much.  The host (Randall) was solid, on his toes, attentive professional and warm.
author: Rosa R.

description:
I had one of those Sundays where I didn't want to make breakfast.  I heard great things about this place through a family friend.  I got their at around 11:45 and the host, who was extremely helpful and nice told me it was a 45 min wait.  And boy was I glad that I waited.

I started out with a coffee cake and the english muffin with homemade peanut butter.  Both were fantastic, and had a lot of flavor.  I wanted to get the best of both worlds so I tried THE PLOW.  The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were to die for, and the sausage patties had so many different flavors it was unbelievable.  The eggs were cooked just like I wanted them and the potatoes were perfectly crispy.  Overall it was a great place.  I will be back for sure.
author: Neil A.

description: Met friends for breakfast at 8:30 on a Sunday morning and still waited for an hour.  Was glad I had a snack on the drive up there!  Appreciated that it's close to the freeway and I could find street parking.  Food is excellent  - loved the "Plow" with bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes and eggs.  For those with kids, know that they don't offer hot chocolate or straws.
author: L N.

description:
went for brunch on a gloomy sunday and was pleasantly surprised with the overall experience.  great, casual hipster vibe.  love the open kitchen, (counter seats get a great view of the action) and really friendly staff who offer hot coffee while you wait.

local, fresh ingredients-- better to show up early because they prepare just enough & run out of favs.  flavorful duck/leek hash, fried egg sandwich with perfectly cooked breakfast potatoes and biscuits & gravy.  Everything on the menu looked/sounded delish- I was drooling over the savory bread pudding but they ran out by the time we were seated.  Next time! and believe me, there will be a next time.
author: Karen F.

description:
Service: 5 Stars
Food: 5 Stars

My fried egg sammy was so delicious, the cheddar cheese was tooo ooo ooo tasty. 
My server was a beauty (dark hair, full lips, long legs) with the personality to match. Very nice. 

The wait was long, but with delicious coffee provided i was very content. 

thanks to the whole plow crew! i'll definitely be back!
author: Chris B.

description: Good food.  Rude service.  Called in an order today (our studio orders from there weekly), i asked for the order to be ready at noon, the girl on the phone huffed and puffed and told me they were too busy.
author: K B.

description:
This place was awesome all around. The service was friendly and more importantly, the food was flawless. We had the granola with yogurt and fresh seasonal fruit (ordered for my 2-year-old daughter), which was delicious and not too sweet since the yogurt was homemade and plain. My husband had the pork chop, eggs, and potatoes, which he said were delicious. My friend also loved her egg sandwich, which was on a brioche-type bread (can't remember exactly what the menu said). I had the vegetarian omelette which was made with mushrooms, leeks, and a little bit of cheese. It was just right- not greasy or runny and just the right amount of vegetables/cheese. The potatoes were awesome- just the right amount of seasoning and a little crunchy on the edges. I also had the decaf coffee which was really good too. A couple of us were thinking about getting the lemon ricotta pancakes while we were waiting because they looked so good coming out of the kitchen, but they were gone by the time we sat down to order. We got there during the last hour of brunch service, so get there earlier if you want to make sure you get some of the more popular menu items! The advantage to getting there later like we did was that we only had to wait 5 to 10 minutes for a table. As far as kid-friendly, I was pleasantly surprised- there was a kids menu which came with a few crayons to color on. They also had high chairs available. 
We're definitely coming back to Plow.
author: Aimee L.

description: If I had a last meal on earth, it would be Plow's lemon ricotta pancakes and those potatoes.  Yes I know it's a tiny spot and you probably/always have to wait, but it is so worth it.  Across the board, the food is delicious.  I am still thinking about those potatoes.
author: Marthe J.

description:
Husb and I checked this out at 1pm today and the line looked intimidating.  We had a very short wait.

The coffee is good (they said they serve Equator coffee)
Food was all good, and high quality.  I had the fried egg sandwich, and my husband had the plow breakfast that comes with lemon ricotta pancakes-- yum!  delicate and flavorful.  Will be back!
author: R N.

description: We have a business at the design center and were driving around looking for an early breakfast other than Sally's. We happened onto this place and loved it. The pumpkin pancakes and egg/bacon sandwich were very good but it's about those potatoes. One Irishman and one German - we were sold. I think this is a little jewel of a place and would go back in a second.
author: Ken B.

description: The food tastes ok but definitely not worth the wait (at least 2x longer than they tell you) or the snotty service.
author: Tom F.

description: The perfect neighborhood brunch and lunch spot.  Went at 11:30 on Monday and there was no line.  The ingredients are fantastic and there is a lot of love put into the cooking.  Very delicious.  I sampled the vegetable omelet and smoked salmon app.  If you have room, you should also try the baked good which are very tasty.  The space is very clean, great light and spacious.
author: Ted C.

description:
Already been half a dozen times (it's one of 11 places within 3 blks of home)

Food fantastic, great tastes. Noticed a bunch of reviews about food quantity, the "Plow" breakfast had four kinds of food and perfect amount of each, I'm happy.  Brunch today, half hour wait, busy kitchen, food HOT (fixed other prob).  Very happy with amounts, notice no obese people. Also, working on what quantities to have on hand. Difficult to manage amounts to keep san franciscans happy and not to waste food. Maxine and Joel like super fresh food. 

I heard one 30-something next to us complain about being seated after others. NOTE, with a half hour wait on some late weekend mornings, some people wander off or to Farleys (or ask staff for coffee), so don't bitch, the staff is very good at seating people in correct order.
author: Edward L.

description: The average wait time was between 45 minutes to an hour for a party of two which is not bad for showing up after 12pm.  The wait was definitely worth it. We split the dungeness crab scramble and the plow so we got to try a little of everything. While the freshly fried potatoes were shatteringly crisp and the sausage was well seasoned the star of the show was definitely the ricotta pancakes. I saved some of the pancakes for last but I really should have eaten it all when it first came out. Sitting on the plate, the pancakes lost some of the lightest and airiness from coming directly off the griddle. The brunch was really simple, well done and satisfying. Best yet I completely cleaned my plate but did not feel heavy or fall into a food coma. All in all it was a great way to start off a Sunday. As we were finishing up our meal a single diner was seated right next to us and I don't remember him waiting in line so this might be an even better call if you are dining alone.
author: Hieu L.

description:
Wow...what an amazing little spot on Potero Hill. Everything here is done right. First off, It starts with the space itself, which was constructed in amazing taste. It has beautiful wood floors, long, large windows, and high ceilings, making the somewhat small space seem larger. 

The food is also great. My wife and I tried a few things on the menu, from the perfectly-assembled fried egg sandwich (potatoes on the side are the best in the bay, hands down), to a surprisingly fresh and flavorful little gem salad, to some delectable sweet fritters that take you to the South, without weighing you down to much. We also had the lusciously textured lemon ricotta pancakes, browned perfectly, and light, and creamy at the same time. 

We were lucky enough to sit at the bar, so we could look into the kitchen and watch everything being made. It all looked fantastic. Very fresh, very simple, and with only the best ingredients. I can't wait to go back and explore their menu a bit. 

Oh yea, I was reading the one and two star reviews just a bit up from mine, and couldn't help feel sorry for these people. They must have woke up on the wrong side of the bed that day. The people the run this place seemed as pleasant as can be. They were accommodating and full of smiles. And since were were sitting at the counter, we got a glimpse into how they were with every patron. Five stars all the way.
author: OperationWayne r.

description: man o man, what a great meal. service was a bit off and aloof but i can be a bit overly critical being a server myself. I have been thinking about driving back over there from Cole Valley this week. I wish someone would open a Plow here in Cole Valley or the Haight.
author: stan f.

description: phenomenal brunch. the food and the ambiance rival each other in fabulousness. what was so surprising about this place was that the service was absolutely delightful -- the host, our waitress, and the guys cooking the food across the counter from us were all in a wonderful and welcoming mood which is all-too-rare at some of these hot restaurants in the city. you must must must get the monkey bread if you go, and the crispy potatoes are like the most incredible hash-brown/home-fries hybrid flavor explosion. i left this place so happy and sated and can't wait to come back for another lovely brunch here.
author: p.c. m.

description: Since the first time I went when I had the legs and eggs I've been disappointed because that hasn't been on the menu so I've been stuck with more traditional breakfast items, like today the fried egg sandwich with bacon, which was fine but how spectacular can that be?  I still love the place
author: David T.

description: Was excited to have new restaurant in the hood. Huge disappointment. Eggs cold, bacon cold, order delivered 40 minutes late while latecomers were receiving theirs before us. Inattentive service, screwed up orders, but mostly defensive attitude of owner in response to complaint about tardy and cold food. Can be sympathetic about kinks in a new business, but come on, people, let's at least be humble about it!  Sadly, not going back.
author: Ginger K.

description: Not a fan of their menu or the food, except for their Lemon Ricotta Pancakes = heaven!  I would go back over and over for these, and I'm not usually a fan of pancakes.  Yummmm!!!
author: Janina V.

description:
I was really excited about this place and eager to try their food and service. We needed a local brunch hangout here badly.

Service was good, our waitress was attentive enough and was very pleasant. Host was nice and accommodating. 

We ordered the frittata and enjoyed it. The side of potatoes were good. Coffee was good, although we had to ask for refill,but no big deal. 

Here is where the 2 rating comes from.....a combination of meh Ive had better frittatas  and the French toast. The menu said it came with creme fraiche but we didn't get any, the flambé bananas had the horrible gas inhaling flavor which was really unattractive. The little 1/2 ounce syrup they bring with it was barely enough for one of the slices so I asked for extra and they said "that will be an extra $3." You shouldn't charge $9.95 for two slices of toast and a little bit of bananas and then another $3 for 1/2 ounce of syrup.   What upset me was that they barely give you any to start with so how are you gonna then charge me 3 dollars for another 1/2  ounce.   I can maybe see $1 for 1 ounce but even that's  ridiculous. I know maple syrup is not cheap but $3, come on man even for San fransisco standards that's a bit much. I think I will continue to drive to Mission Beach for future brunch events where they don't charge for extra on something as small as maple syrup. 

I have a feeling if they continue to charge extra for things that are pretty standard at other brunch places and their food is not that blown away good,they may not get a lot of business, but I hope it changes.
author: cacao r.

description: Come here on a Saturday morning at 10. Waited about 30 minutes to be seated. I sat down and ordered the spinach mushroom eggs Benedict. The food came out pretty fast, and the presentation was awesome and the food was delicious. I would come back if I had the chance
author: Victor C.

description: This place is amazing. By far, the best breakfast I have had in the city!
author: Cindy M.

description: I wanted so much to like this place......however it proved to be huge disappointment. table behind us that sat way after we did gets served first  your basic eggs and toast ....we ordered your basic eggs and toast as well , yet we had a 45 minute wait for cold scrambled eggs...cold toast.....and the owners total lack of concern...his response was an aggressive : "what would you like me to do?" .....I am sorry I am not running the restaurant ; he is....he should know what to do.....
author: jack f.

description: Loved the ambiance and the service was excellent. Food was good, but not incredible. A nice, reliable brunch place - and fun to explore Potrero (an area I seldom spend time in)
author: Tadeek P.

description: the line for a weekend brunch is always long, but the cheerful and friendly greeter will make sure you'll have a cup of coffee in your hand while you wait. more importantly, the well-prepared meals here are delicious and worth the time it takes to make; the egg sandwich here has the mark of a signature dish that can be easily profiled for tv.
author: Quyen N.

description: had an amazing brunch here!  yes the wait blows but the food was worth it.  had the best tuna salad sandwich ever and the potatoes were so divine.  went at 11am on sat and had to wait an hour.  so get there early!
author: Gina P.

description: Went for brunch on a Friday late morning (11am) and the place was packed. Waited ~30minutes for a table for 4. But once seated, wait staff was pleasant and service was prompt. The 'Plow' was a great sampling of everything (eggs, crispy potatoes, sausage, pancakes). The pancakes were a little too sweet and cake-like for my taste, but they were fluffy and light. Would probably go back to try some of their other dishes.
author: c H.

description: I'm reluctant to say anything that will make this place MORE popular, but it really is a wonderful restaurant.  Get there right when it opens and the wait's not too bad.  Maybe I'll see you there!
author: Tom L.

description: 4 stars for food.  The food hear was amazing, but today our service was...  Well, let's just say the waitress seemed to have a late night out the night before.  She forgot one person's beverages, repeatedly and then charged us for an extra coffee...  Then when I brought the bill discrepancy to the manager, he gave us all our coffees free, but then she rang up the original wrong amount on our check.  I would return for the food, but hope our service is better next time.
author: Tiffany L.

description: delicious breakfast, awesome atmosphere, quiet neighborhood. buuut...if their donut holes were on Chopped they'd get cut. and that makes me question the up to 1.5 hour wait for brunch.
author: Dee C.

description: We had breakfast here this morning, got there early and still had to sit at the bar.  I wasn't sure what to expect because I had read the food was overrated,  that is just not true.  We started with the doughnut that had creme filling, I had the Plow which the pancakes, bacon and POTATOES are all amazing.  It is enough food for two people to split if you start with a doughnut or Brioche.  Husband had the biscuits and gravy,  they were very good.  Kind of on the rich side so if you are used to a more savory gravy you may want to try something else.  All and all the staff were so nice and what you would expect from a neighborhood spot like this one.  Sadly we are moving off the hill but I will still come back just for Plow.
author: Brooke K.

description: Best brunch place we've found so far.  There's always a long line (hint hint - expand please) and the food takes forever (so don't go when you're in a rush) but it's so goooood.
author: jean m.

description: Plow is, by far, the best spot in San Francisco to enjoy breakfast. It's actually converted me into a breakfast fan after years of false promises or inconsistencies elsewhere. From the outstanding epicurean delights (lemon ricotta pancakes...!) to genuinely convivial and efficient service to warm, open, and clean ambience, your senses will awaken happily here. If you're going solo, enjoy the counter and triptych windows framing the oak tree; groups can enjoy comfortable tables with abundant indirect light. Thanks for rekindling opportunities to savor Equator Coffee while anticipating another outstanding meal (lunch too) before launching back into our City.
author: Geo G.

description: I am from out of town and found Plow through Yelp.  The reviews were correct.  The food was incredible and the staff was extremely friendly.  There was a wait, but well worth it.  I had the eggs with spinach and cheese with a side of the lemon pancakes.  WOW!  Very good and the pancake was light and unique.  Coffee was great too and given to you to help the wait go by quickly.
author: Barry S.

description: Delicious! As I have said in a previous review I consider myself a bit of a brunch expert/ fanatic and I've been to all the "favorite" brunch spots in SF. This is definitely a top 3 for me! We only got the Plow and the breakfast sandwich but both were delicious. Will definitely be back!
author: Victoria K.

description: The food is downright delicious. If you have no problem with waiting or the service, run here. It rocks. The pancakes are more of a dessert, but man are they delicious. Everything else is amazing as well, although the biscuits and gravy are just that, and little else. The eggs benedict/florentine are amazing, the potatoes are the best I've had anywhere (and I normally dislike fried potatoes)... the coffee kind of sucks though. Why not work with Farley's up the street? They are your neighbors and taste pretty dang good. The reason for -2 stars is this... partly the coffee, but mostly the fact that I showed up 10 minutes before 8am on a Saturday, on my BIRTHDAY, to get a table. And there was one, for 6 people, but you let 4 people sit there, because a few of the people from my group were still packing their things to get to the airport... and they arrived at the restaurant before anyone who had been seated had ordered anything. I understand you are a small operation, but to not be friendly at all, to not only make us wait when we shouldn't have had to, to not offer us a cup of coffee, to not try to accomodate us (oh, you want to sit outside on a sunny day? Maybe we should move the tables? Ooooh...) is just kind of... annoying. I just had higher hopes... Ruby Wine was so nice, but both seem to cater to the Potrero stereotype of middle-aged and wealthy... I guess if you are a 20-something graduate student (nicely dressed, thank you) you aren't worth paying attention to. I'm sad, because the food was so great--- but the attitude and atmosphere will never bring me back, and recommending against this place in the future (sad also, since I live and work nearby). Oh well.
author: Amanda S.

description: My new favorite brunch place. Best biscuits and gravy I've had in the Bay Area - flavorful rather than just salty gravy. Pleasant tasting lemon ricotta pancakes. I'd stay away from the cassoulet - it's the only bland offering.
author: Aiko S.

description: This is hands-down the best breakfast spot on Potrero Hill, maybe all of SF.  As with any great breakfast spot with limited seating, the wait can be a little long depending on the time you come.  If you time it just right, or can be patient enough to enjoy the gorgeous views of the SF skyline, you will not be disappointed.  The food is spot-on and the service is fantastic.  The fried egg sandwich and the signature plow are both amazing!
author: Arash G.

description: I love neighborhood gems. Although, if you are starving on a weekend, do not bother to come here. Wait takes forever. Food is so so.
author: Liz L.

description: We ordered the Market Omelette with the side of Lemon Ricotta Pancake and Fried Egg Sandwich with bacon.  The crispy potatoes are a must try if it doesn't already come with your dish. My first taste of the pancake made me wished I had ordered the whole stack.  The sandwich looked really well put together.  I like the fact that they used frisee lettuce it holds up very well especially when the yolk is broken and all its gooey goodness gets all over them.  Everything was very well seasoned and I'm giving it 4 stars for overall quality of ingredients and taste.  With that said there is definitely room for improvement in the kitchen and in the service.  My omelette hardly had any mushrooms and I ended up eating 3/4 of it before I actually had any shiitake and sad to say the oyster mushrooms were no where to be found.  The staff was really friendly but need more attention to water and coffee refills.
author: Pamela M.

description: What an amazing brunch spot! Every bite was delicious and fresh. I'm so excited to have found this little gem! Best fried chicken sandwich I've ever had, celery root slaw! The service was friendly and attentive and the prices were very reasonable. I will definitely be going back very soon, maybe even tomorrow. Can't wait to try the french toast with caramelized bananas!
author: Jennifer M.

description: so yummy.. ricotta pancakes, potatoes, french toast, all of it was amazing!
author: Abhaya S.

description: only the best best best best brunch in all of the bay area.  sorry other guys, but me and my friend been going to brunch once a month for YEARS.  and this is it.  this is truly it.  everything.  everything is delicious and perfect.  and the people are really nice and real.  and the place is sunny and beautiful.  and yes.  but dont go, because the lines are already too long.  :)
author: Karen P.

description: The food is amazing!  It was so good that I want to go back tomorrow and try something else.  I had the chicken tinga.  The presentation was great and it was delicious.  The coffee there is also really good.  Also the atmosphere was really welcoming.  Great lighting in the restaurant.  What a great spot! I'll definitely be back!  Highly recommended
author: Jeff M.

description: Ok, so this is my 2nd Yelp review ever and the fact that I'm taking the time to review this AWESOME place, what does that say? Hands down, the BEST brunch ever in SF. My hubs & I grew up in the Bay Area & often go to SF for culinary adventures. We had a spontaneous New Years 2day adventure in SF and this was THE highlight. (Hey, we like food.) Hubs found it on Yelp - paying it forward, yes I am - and when we saw/read their website, we knew it was THE brunch place for us. Worth the 20min wait (altho' I can see it being longer at times). I had the egg sandwich (all about that cheese) and a side of 1 lemon ricotta pancake - which also came with those yummy potatos. My hubs had The Plow - a little bit of everything. Their crispy potatoes are phenom. Their lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for. The rest all culminates together - the friendly service, the intimate ambiance, the very nice owners-couple, the other excited patrons, the location, the venue - to make for a perfect way to start off your day. If you live in, near or are planning a trip to SF, I can't recommend this place enough for brekkie, lunch or wkend brunch...Just be patient - grab a coffee down the block - as you may have to wait a few minutes. But I say it again - it's DEF worth the wait. I will be back. Soon, I hope.
author: Lulu B.

description: The man & I had brunch there this past Sunday morning on the later side, really on the later side since we waited at least 45 minutes to be seated.  However, to be fair, they did say it would be that long and we stuck it out.  It's nice to have someplace like this to walk to. There really isn't any place to wait inside but it was a lovely day and there is Farley's & Hazel's the next block up for coffee while you wait.  It's a beautiful looking place but not great for crowds, they just don't have the capacity for it.  They might be able to accommodate 6 but probably not more than that.  We got seated at the bar, I always find it fascinating to watch a kitchen staff work.  We ordered egg sandwich (me), lamb sandwich (the man) and the lemon ricotta pancakes (to share).  Our waiter was nice if a bit tentative.  Everything but the egg sandwich came out, after we realized it wasn't coming, we told him about it and he said they're working on it now.  Then we saw him talking to the kitchen staff about it a few minutes later when it still didn't come out.  He hadn't followed through with the kitchen about it.  It eventually came and it was quite good, though quite messy, but I've yet to eat an egg sandwich that wasn't messy.  He was quite apologetic though it would have been nice to have been comped for it or had our bill reduced in some way.  The lamb sandwich was fabulous, perfectly cooked lamb topped with salsa verde which gave it a wonderful bright herbally flavor with a nice garlic kick.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were lovely, so light with nicely done edges.  No, they aren't big but when they taste like this, who cares?  I usually have regret when I order pancakes because they're so dense but not this time.  Nits aside, we'll definitely go back, it's a great addition to the neighborhood.  They open for brunch at 8 am, to avoid a marathon wait I would strongly suggest going early or going later.  I may just have to try bribing the man with brunch to get him out of bed early.
author: Nicole B.

description: One of the best lunches I've had in a long time!  I am in the area a bunch and have eaten at many of the nearby restaurants, but this one blows the others out of the water.  Food is fresh, delicious and stunningly prepared.  The atmosphere is perfection and very true to their culinary style.
author: Jamie A.

description: I didn't want to join yelp to write a bad review but at this time and age I would never expect to get this kind of treatment in San Francisco. My sister and I decide to have lunch one day and we found Plow and decided to try it. The waitresses seated some people before us but from the moment we walked in they didn't even acknowledge our existence! Seriously? No hi? The waitresses weren't even busy but my sister and I waited to be polite. So this older white guy walks in and in less then 5 mins he gets "hi, what can I help you with?" and tells him about 15 minsso I step in and say "really? We been here for 15 mins and before him" she says it will be 30 mins and I said then what about that guy. She says oh it will be 30 mins too. Really? I specifically heard you say 15 for him. And this WHOLE time there is a table for two. I don't care if the food is good if that's the service you going to get. Or is it because my sister and I are Asian? Thanks Plow for ruining my appetite!
author: Cristina M.

description: It really doesn't get any better than this.  Possibly the best breakfast/brunch experience I've ever had. The ingredients are outstanding and the presentation spectacular. Dishes are ten notches above any comprable restaurant's.  If the food wasn't impressive enough, the atmosphere and decor are equally remarkable. Everything is fabulous, yet comfortable and familiar, without being pretentious.  Definitely worth the wait. Congrats Plow - such a treat to dine at your restaurant!  Thank you!
author: Ana R.

description: I loved everything about it!, and I can be a critical audience. The food was unbelievable, fresh, hot and yummy(everything I wanted in my Sunday morning brunch do whatever I want to do start to my day). The service was awesome. The atmosphere was light filled with great energy, modern meets rustic done just right. Fantastico:)
author: James M.

description: Great new neighborhood place on Potrero Hill, brought to us by  a couple who are Potrero Hill residents. Great space, love the big windows; I wish it were larger, but you work with what you have. My 6 yr old loved the lemon ricotta pancakes and defended his plate from parental poaching. You can taste the great ingredients and attention to detail in every bite. Loved the baked goods and especially the homemade jam. Highly recommend this place for a great breakfast. Be warned that there could be a wait since there was considerable pent-up demand for just such a restaurant on the Hill. I am looking forward to trying the lunch options sometime during the week when I can squeeze into a single place at the bar.
author: Abigail M.

description: outstanding brunch every time...  I personally feel it's one of the best here in the city... refined and creative enough...  very local feeling ... friendly, professional service... you just need to be there to taste it to appreciate it...
author: William W.

description: food/service solid but i don't understand the hype - definitely not worth waiting for - food is rather bland and uninspired.
author: Stacy N.

description: We waited the expected 30-45 minutes, which was OK, especially since it was a nice day. Didn't quite understand why it took 15 minutes to prepare the empty table we ended up sitting at, but they were busy, so this was understandable. My wife ordered the cake/pastry that was on the menu (sorry but don't remember the kind) and coffee and I ordered the fried egg sandwich and bacon. This didn't seem like a lot of food, but still took about 20 minutes to get. The cake was quite good and the potatoes that came with the fried egg sandwich were wonderful, as other reviewers have said. The problem was the sandwich itself. I didn't order it over hard but it seemed like it was about half yolk. At first I picked it up to eat as a sandwich and ended up with a river of yolk pouring out! The taste of the sandwich, eating it with a nice and fork after that, was quite good. So the overall experience for us was 3 stars or less. So if your prepared for the wait, possibly slow service, and the runny egg sandwich (or order it over hard) your experience should be better.  I must say that all the food that people were eating around us looked great.
author: Sandy S.
